segments.text: Oh, this scene brings back so many memories.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing by the sink, drying a plate, just like my mom used to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, but she hasn't noticed yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I remember when I used to climb on stools to get cookies from the jar, just like those kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, trying to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is standing nearby, waiting for a cookie, just like my siblings used to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they're careful and don't fall, the stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, making a big puddle, but the woman is completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I remember the taste of those cookies, it was always worth the risk of climbing on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope the woman turns off the faucet soon before the water causes any damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene really brings back some happy memories from my childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR
